a.span: Remote Registration Process for New Students During COVID-19

div.h1: Remote Registration Process for New Students During COVID-19

strong.em: Like many school districts, ETHS is adapting to the ever-changing environment during the COVID-19 pandemic. Information for current students, guardians, and the community can be found on the
and Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs). As a result, each of the steps will be supported by ETHS staff remotely. This page is the Registration Process that will be followed during this time.
If your child is transferring to ETHS now, or planning to attend ETHS next year, follow these steps.

hr.h3: Verify Student Lives in District Boundaries

div.span: In order to register to attend Evanston Township High School District 202, students must live within district boundaries on a full-time permanent basis (seven days and seven nights). The District 202
includes the City of Evanston and a small portion of Skokie. Please verify that your child lives within our District's attendance area before completing these registration steps.

div.strong: If your child has never been enrolled at ETHS, go to the

to register a new account and begin the enrollment process. In order to complete the registration process, the registering parent/guardian must submit the following documents as part of the online enrollment form:

li.strong: Proof of residency documentation from Category A and Category B
Physical (both sides of the official form) and Immunization records, if available

p.span: If you have questions about these documents, contact the Residency Officer at (847) 424-7182.
Additional documents that may be necessary to submit:

li.strong: Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE) Student Transfer Form

div.p: If you have questions about these documents, contact the Registrar’s Office at (847) 424-7180.

p.span: If your student is transferring from a private school or out of state school, at time of submitting enrollment documents proving residency a “Good Standing Form” will be faxed/emailed to the last school attended. Once the form is returned to the Registrar’s office and found that your student is leaving in “good standing”, you will move forward in the enrollment process.

div.strong: Once you complete the online form, you must click "Submit" at the bottom of the page in order for ETHS to receive the form. Online registration forms that are more than one month old without submitted required documents will be deleted.
div.span: If you have questions about the online form, contact the Student Enrollment Specialist at (847) 424-7915.

If a school physical and immunization was not submitted via the online enrollment form, then it may be submitted to the Nurses' Office drop boxes available at Entrance 2 of ETHS. A physical examination within one year of starting school or a copy of previous high school exam. If the previous high school exam was within the state of Illinois, it will be accepted from any high school year. If the exam was done outside the state of Illinois, it must have been done within one year of enrollment at ETHS.
If you have questions at this step, contact the Nurses' Office at (847) 424-7260.

h3.span: The Registrar will schedule an Enrollment Appointment with the registering parent or guardian and student(s). During this appointment, the transfer student(s) will complete an online Transfer Student Questionnaire and important documents will be reviewed. A placement testing date will be scheduled during this meeting.

div.span: ETHS uses the Measures of Academic Progress (MAP) test as one measure to determine course placement. Visit the
for more information about the placement process and placement testing. ETHS will accept official MAP score reports from other schools as long as they are no more than 1 year old.
. Fees must be paid annually. Fee waivers for annual school fees are granted on a yearly basis to those families whose students qualify for the Free and Reduced Price Meal Program. Complete the

For transportation options, please see the Parking and Transportation page. If your student uses public transportation, purchase a Ventra card in the Student Accounts Office (H110) and reinstate annually.

hr.h3: STEP 6 - Review & Request Course Options - Orientation or Counselor Follow-Up

div.span: prepare to request course options. Students who will attend ETHS in August will attend Orientation and receive their schedule at that time. Families registering to attend ETHS this school year will hear from the Counseling Office to schedule a counseling appointment once the enrollment folder is received from the Registrar and Steps 1-4 are complete.

em.strong: Si necesitan ayuda en español por favor llamen a la Oficina del Enlace latino al (847) 424-7166.

strong.em: You must provide documents from BOTH Category A and Category B.

td.strong: Category A – One (1) of the following documents:
Category B – Two (2) of the following documents

ul.li: Real estate or property tax bill
Signed lease (Lease must expire after the first day of school for the upcoming school year)
